rundown: 8-6 W vs Miami Marlins Erick Fedde: 5.0 innings, 4 earned runs, 5 hits, 0 HR, 4 strikeouts Batters: Marcell Ozuna (2 hits - 4 AB, 2 HR, 4 RBI) Drake Baldwin (2 hits - 4 AB, 0 HR, 3 RBI) Matt Olson (1 hit - 4 AB, 0 HR, 1 RBI) The Braves secured a victory against the Miami Marlins with a strong offensive performance, scoring 8 runs on 11 hits. Marcell Ozuna was the standout player, hitting two home runs and driving in four runs. Drake Baldwin also contributed significantly with two hits and three RBIs. Despite giving up four earned runs, Erick Fedde managed to keep the Marlins at bay for five innings. Key highlights include: 1. Marcell Ozuna's two home runs, which were crucial in building the Braves' lead. 2. Drake Baldwin's consistent hitting, contributing three RBIs to the team's total. 3. The Braves' ability to outscore the Marlins despite allowing six runs, showcasing their offensive depth.
